title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says the low-pressure area is in the Southwest Bay of Bengal is likely to move further north-westwards towards the north Tamil Nadu and south Andhra Pradesh coast during the next 2 days.

title: 13 die as Indian navy speedboat crashes into passenger ferry off Mumbai
byline: An Indian navy speedboat crashed into a ferry carrying over 100 people to a popular tourist destination off Mumbai on Wednesday, killing at least 13, the navy said.

title: Sri Lanka’s candidate elected to UNESCO’s Intangible Cultural Heritage Evaluation Body
byline: Sri Lanka’s candidate, Dr. Bilinda Devage Nandadeva was elected as an expert to the prestigious Evaluation Body of UNESCO’s 2003 Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage (ICH) at the 19th Session of the ICH Committee Meeting held in Asunción, Paraguay.

title: 2024 census completed, preliminary report within a month
byline: The Department of Census and Statistics has completed the final phase of this year’s Population and Housing Census, with data collection focusing on homeless individuals conducted yesterday (18), between 10:00 p.m. and 12:00 midnight.

title: Diplomatic steps to reclaim social security funds of Sri Lankan workers in Cyprus
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Member of Parliament Lakshman Nipuna Arachchi has announced that diplomatic measures will be initiated to secure the release of social security funds owed to Sri Lankan workers employed in Cyprus.

title: 16 deaths reported in fatal accidents on expressways so far this year
byline: Sri Lanka Police says that a total of 16 people have died in 12 fatal accidents on the expressways of Sri Lanka as of December 14 this year.

title: 2024 O/L exam dates announced
byline: The Examinations Department announced that the 2024 (2025) G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination will be held from the 17th of March to the 26th of March, 2025.

title: Sri Lanka to give free visas to 39 countries - Foreign Minister
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Vijitha Herath, has provided an update on the country’s strategic efforts to revitalize its tourism sector, which has faced unprecedented challenges in recent years due to the Easter Sunday attacks, the COVID-19 pandemic, and the economic crisis.

title: Passenger boat capsizes off Mumbai coast with more than 80 on board
byline: A boat carrying 80 passengers and five crew members capsized off the coast of India’s financial capital Mumbai after a speedboat struck it on Wednesday, local and government officials said.

title: 16,000 MT of rice imported within two weeks
byline: Around 16,000 metric tonnes of rice has been imported to Sri Lanka as of 3:30 p.m. today (18), following the relaxing of import restrictions on rice.

title: President expresses gratitude to China for debt restructuring support and economic assistance
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has expressed his gratitude to the Chinese government for its support during debt restructuring as well as in the face of the economic crisis.

title: Sri Lankan jailed for 37 years for killing wife with axe in front of teenage children
byline: A killer has been jailed for 37 years for murdering his wife with an axe in front of their teenage children, in what a judge has described as a brutal and horrific attack.

title: Sri Lankan man charged for alleged sexual assault on Melbourne flight
byline: A Sri Lankan man faced Broadmeadows Magistrates Court today (19 December, 2024) charged with allegedly committing an act of indecency on board an international flight.

title: Warrant issued for arrest of Gnanasara Thero
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has issued a warrant for the arrest of the General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) Organization, Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thero and to produce him before the court.

title: Police constable injured in attack with broken bottle at Horana
byline: A police constable was reportedly attacked with a broken empty liquor bottle at an inn in Horana.

title: Cabinet approval to import salt to resolve shortage
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the import of up to 30,000 metric tons of non-iodized salt by the State Trading Corporation to address the ongoing salt shortage in the market.

title: Cabinet nod for review of SOEs with non-commercial interests
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the review of State-Owned Enterprises (SOEs) with non-commercial interests.

title: Sri Lanka to import of high-quality dairy cattle from Pakistan
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the import of high-quality genetic dairy cattle from Pakistan in an effort to increase local milk production.

title: Sri Lanka Police to receive Rs. 300M Indian grant for new vehicles
byline: The Government of India has agreed to provide financial assistance amounting to Sri Lankan Rs. 300 million to address vehicle requirements for the Sri Lanka Police, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa announced during the Cabinet press briefing held today (19).

title: ADB extends $150 million line of credit to CEB
byline: Asian Development Bank (ADB) and Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) signed an agreement on Thursday for the ADB to provide a loan of $150 million to the CEB.

title: Compulsory retirement age of govt doctors extended
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the extension of the compulsory age limit of retirement for government medical officers up to 63 years, with amendments to be made in line with the Pensions Act.

title: Boat carrying over 100 Myanmar refugees reaches Mullaitivu
byline: A boat carrying over 100 refugees from Myanmar has reached the shores of the Mullivaikkal area in Mullaitivu, according to Sri Lanka Navy and Police officers in Mullaitivu.

title: Sri Lanka must stick with IMF programme in ‘good times and bad’ – Ranil
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe says that criticism pertaining to the country’s economy should be made within the framework of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) agreement.

title: Defence Ministry sets deadline to return licensed firearms provided to civilians
byline: Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Defence today informed licensees to return all licensed firearms that have not been returned and submitted for inspection, before January 20, 2025, in line with the decision taken to ensure a safe society by minimizing the use and misuse of firearms in the civil society and by implementing proper regulation.

title: Train derails at Rambukkana causing delays
byline: A train traveling from Colombo Fort to Rambukkana has derailed this evening (19) at the Rambukkana railway station after completing its route and while returning to the yard.
